summary: App.tsx adds a service-to-content mapping and state for a selected service plus a ref intended for a bottom description section, and project summaries describe clickable service cards that scroll to a fixed bottom description section. However, the diff evidence is insufficient/unclear for the required bottom-section Call/WhatsApp actions, mobile sticky-bar non-obscuring behavior, and the requirement for *exact* description strings (mapping currently stores descriptions as arrays of sentences rather than the single exact strings provided).

missing_requirements.requirement: Implement the exact bottom-section content mapping (English) so each selected item shows the exact provided heading and description text (no paraphrasing).
missing_requirements.reason: In App.tsx, each service description is stored as an array of sentence strings rather than the single exact description string specified; without evidence of concatenation into the exact provided text, the 'exact text' acceptance criterion is not demonstrably met.

missing_requirements.requirement: Include Call and WhatsApp buttons below the description in the shared bottom section (tel:+919840077591 and existing wa.me click-to-chat via WhatsAppQuickMessages).
missing_requirements.reason: The provided App.tsx excerpt shows phoneNumber/whatsappNumber constants and imports WhatsAppQuickMessages, but does not show the bottom section rendering Call and WhatsApp actions/buttons as required (truncation prevents verification).

missing_requirements.requirement: Ensure click-to-scroll does not interfere with the existing mobile sticky bottom action bar; bottom section remains readable and not obscured after scrolling on mobile.
missing_requirements.reason: No evidence is shown of scroll-offset handling, spacing, or other measures ensuring the scrolled-to bottom description section is not hidden behind the mobile sticky action bar (truncation prevents verification).
